ext_descriptions.ext_description: A presentable_text is any string which can be presented.

ext_description.p: The string shall not contain any control characters.
ext_description.note: This prohibits linefeed and carriage return characters in presentable_text.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An annotation_occurrence is a type of . An annotation_occurrence defines occurrences of annotation by combining two-dimensional geometry or annotation elements with style for presentation purposes. The annotation_occurrences shall be used only in representations which are defined for annotation purposes, i.e., , , , , or . An annotation_occurrence may be either an , or an , or an , or an , or an .
An annotation_occurrence shall be a .

ext_description.p: The annotation_occurrences shall be used only in representations which are defined for annotation purposes: , .

An annotation_curve_occurrence is a type of . An annotation_curve_occurrence is a or set of curves with a style assignment.

An annotation_symbol_occurrence is a type of . An annotation_symbol_occurrence is an
with a style assignment or a

An annotation_table_occurrence is a type of
An annotation_table_occurrence is an
with a style assignment or a

An annotation_occurrence_relationship is the association of two annotation_occurrences.
There is no significance to the ordering of the two related annotation_occurrences. The use of the different attribute names serves only to distinguish the names.
the word, or group of words, by which the annotation_occurrence_relationship is referred to.
text that relates the nature of the annotation_occurrence_relationship.
the first of two annotation_occurrences which are related.
the second of two annotation_occurrences which are related.

A table_text_relationship is a type of
A table_text_relationship establishes a relationship between a field in an
and an . It is used to include text in a field of a table.
the particular field in the table in which the text is positioned.

the
in which text is positioned.

the
positioned in the table.

ext_description.p:
The
shall present an .
The field shall be a field in the table in which the text is positioned.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The text_delineation type is provided to control the delineation of text.
Application protocols may specify legal values of text_delineation and associate precise meaning with those values.
An application protocol may specify that the only permitted values of this type are 'underline' and 'overline', and associate these with the delineation of text as shown in figure 14.
Examples of text delineation
The defined_symbol_select specifies the implicit description of a .

The text_or_character specifies the items which can be used in an
or a .

The text_alignment is provided to control the alignment of text.
Application protocols shall specify legal values of the text_alignment and shall associate precise meaning with those values.
An Application Protocol may specify that the only permitted values of this type are 'left', 'centre' and 'right', and associate these to the positioning of text with respect to alignment points as shown in figure 13.
Examples of text alignment

The text_path specifies the direction of the location of the next text character relative to the current character. The next text character can appear to the left of the current character, to the right of the current character, above the current character, or below the current character.
the next character is placed to the right of the current character.
the next character is placed to the left of the current character.
the next character is placed above the current character.
the next character is placed below the current character.

An annotation_fill_area is a type of . An annotation_fill_area is a set of curves that may be filled with hatching, shading, colour, or tiling. The annotation_fill_area is described by boundaries which consist of non-intersecting, non-self-intersecting closed curves. These curves form the boundary of planar areas to be filled according to the style for the annotation_fill_area. The filling is defined by the following rules:
A curve that is not surrounded by any other curve is a border between an unfilled area on the outside and a filled area on the inside. see figure 15 a).
A curve surrounds an unfilled area if it is surrounded by another curve whose inside is a filled area. see figure 15 b).
If a third curve is placed inside of the second curve this curve surrounds a filled area. see figure 15 c).
For each additional curve the procedure is applied in the same manner.
Filling of annotation fill areas
a set of curves that define the boundaries of the fill area.

ext_description.p: All the curves in the set boundaries shall be closed and planar.
If there are two or more curves in the set boundaries, all of these curves shall be coplanar, and no two curves shall intersect each other.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A defined_symbol is a type of . A defined_symbol is a symbol that has an implicit definition, either through a or an .
a description of the scaling, placement, and orientation of the defined_symbol.
an implicit description of a symbol, either pre-defined or externally defined.

A defined_table is a type of
that specifies an implicit definition of a table.

A symbol_target is a type of . A symbol_target is the target of the transformation which determines the location and orientation of a
used as an , or the target of a . It consists of an oriented position and a scaling in x and y.
the scale applied to the y coordinates of the or of the .
the scale applied to the x coordinates of the or of the .
the location and orientation of a or of a used as an .
A pre_defined_symbol is a type of . A pre_defined_symbol allows a conforming exchange to define an application-specific symbol. The actual symbol shall be defined by an Application Protocol.

An externally_defined_symbol is a type of
that makes an external reference to a symbol.

An annotation_symbol is a type of . An annotation_symbol is the mapping of a
as a
to present that
as part of a picture.
Figure 16 shows examples of annotation symbols.
Examples of annotation symbols

indicating where the symbol is to be placed.

which maps the .

ext_description.p: An instance of annotation_symbol shall also be an instance of .

A symbol_representation is a type of
used in the assembly of a symbol. It allows also the definition of annotation_tables which are a specialization of annotation_symbols. The symbol_representations may only be related to each other using symbol_representation_relationships.

A symbol_representation_with_blanking_box is a type of
that includes a box which blanks out all other elements in the box.
a box which blanks out any element in the box with exception of the symbol itself.
The blanking box shall be in the .

A table_representation is a type of
used for creating tables. The table_representations may only be related with
entities. If a table_representation plays the role of
in a , only a
may play the role of .

All users of
in role
and

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A table_record_representation is a type of
used for creating records within tables. Two table_record_representations may only be related by table_representation_relationships. If a table_record_representation plays the role of
in a , only a
may play the role of .

ext_description.p:
Either a table_record_representation shall be used as a
in a , or it shall be mapped into a .

All users of type
in role
or

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A table_record_field_representation is a type of
used for creating fields within records of a table. The table_record_field_representations may only be related by entities. If a table_record_field_representation plays the role of
in a , only a table_record_field_representation may play the role of .

ext_description.p:
Either a table_record_field_representation shall be used as a
in a , or it shall be mapped into a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A table_record_field_representation_with_clipping_box is a type of
which includes a clipping box to blank out all elements outside of the box.

a
that defines the boundary for clipping the contents of the .
The clipping_box shall be in the same context as the table_record_field_representation_with_clipping_box.

A symbol_representation_relationship is a type of
to relate symbol_representations in a hierarchical order.
a that plays the role of a parent (root) in a tree of symbol_representations.
a that plays the role of a child (leaf) in a tree of symbol_representations.

ext_description.p: A symbol_representation_relationship shall not participate in a tree of symbol_representations where the root of the tree is also a leaf of its own tree.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A table_representation_relationship is a type of
used to relate table_representations, table_record_representations, and table_record_field_representations.

An annotation_text is a type of . An annotation_text is the mapping of a
which contains , , , or annotation_text entities as a
to present that
as part of a picture. This structure allows an annotation_text to be a simple string of characters, a collection of strings, or a more complex collection of strings and characters.

which positions and orients the annotation_text.

that specifies the delineation of the text. The type of delineation and its effect on the appearance of the text is specified in an Application Protocol.

or an .

A pre_defined_character_glyph is a type of . A pre_defined_character_glyph allows a conforming exchange to define an application-specific character glyph. The actual character glyph shall be defined by an Application Protocol.
A text_literal is a type of . A text_literal is a definition of a text string using a string literal.
the text literal to be presented.

ext_description.p:
The acyclic_composite_text function examines a
instance to see if it participates in its own definition. It returns TRUE if the
instance is acyclic (does not participate in its own definition) and FALSE if it is cyclic (does participate in its own definition).

The function first checks to see if it is among its own
set, and returns FALSE if it is.

Next, it creates a local set of all instances of
in its own
set. It then adds to this set all of the instances of
that are referenced by the
used by the
used by any
in its own
set. This local set is added to the set of instances already examined. If the set of instances already examined does not increase in size, then all possibilities have been examined and the function returns TRUE. Otherwise, the function is then called recursively to check further.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
which is tested. This is input to the function.

the text_or_characters referenced by start_composite. This is input to the function. On initial input this set contains as its only element the
of the start_composite.

The acyclic_symbol_representation_relationship function determines if a
is used in the tree of symbol_representation_relationships that defines this . It returns TRUE if it is not acyclic, and FALSE if there is.

the
which is tested. This is input to the function.

the symbol_representations referenced by relation. This is input to the function. On initial input this set contains as only element the
of the relation.
The control_characters_free is a function that examines a string for the occurrence of control characters. It returns true if no control character is found in the string.
the string that is examined for control characters.

ext_description.p:
The field_in_table function is a function that examines a
and an , and returns the value TRUE if the field is in the table, and FALSE if the field is not in the table.

The function first finds the that the
maps.

It then finds all the s which are either related to the
entity by a
or are included in the
through a .

Finally, it returns FALSE if there are no
entities which relate to the field by a
or include the field through a , and returns TRUE otherwise.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the table record field which shall be in the table. This is input to the function.
the annotation table which shall contain the field. This is input to the function.
A pds_geometric_representation_item_subtypes is a constraint, that specifies a constraint that applies to instances of subtypes of .
